result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Destiny Rae Rockman

records.addlTxt: conditions added to previous conditions set on 9/6/2022: Defendant must waive extradition from the reservation. If request by law enforcement, defendant to submit to random drug testing. All conditions listed on ACBS filed on 9/23/2022.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant must waive extradition from the reservation. If request by law enforcement, defendant to submit to random drug testing. Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.

9:19 AM Prosecuting attorney John Luetscher in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Destiny Rae Rockman in court, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Destiny Rae Rockman. Court has reviewed the bond motion filed. Atty Hansen heard on his motion. Response by State. Court makes stmt. Court amends cash bond. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg.

9:15 AM Prosecuting attorney John Luetscher in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Destiny Rae Rockman in court, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Destiny Rae Rockman. Court makes stmt w/ meeting w/ counsel in chambers prior to hrg today. PQW received/reviewed by the Court w/ defendant. Court finds waiver to be made freely and voluntarily and accepts waiver. Court further finds probable cause a felony has been committed and defendant bound over to circuit court. Court proceeds w/ BBH.
Arraignment scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:03 PM Attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Destiny Rae Rockman, in custody, in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Destiny Rae Rockman. Waives reading of complaint and request PH within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: w/conditions Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing. Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages.

2:56 PM Defendant Destiny Rae Rockman appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, and advised of right to counsel/SPD.  Bond is set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
